properties.name: id
properties.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

properties.name: meta
properties.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

properties.name: implicitRules
properties.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

properties.name: language
properties.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.

properties.name: name
properties.definition: A name associated with the Bot.

properties.name: description
properties.definition: A summary, characterization or explanation of the Bot.

properties.name: runtimeVersion
properties.definition: The identifier of the bot runtime environment (i.e., vmcontext, awslambda, etc).

properties.name: cron[x]
properties.definition: A schedule for the bot to be executed.

properties.name: category
properties.definition: A code that classifies the service for searching, sorting and display purposes (e.g. "Surgical Procedure").
properties.comment: There may be multiple axis of categorization depending on the context or use case for retrieving or displaying the resource.  The level of granularity is defined by the category concepts in the value set.

properties.name: runAsUser
properties.definition: Optional flag to indicate that the bot should be run as the user.

properties.name: auditEventTrigger
properties.definition: Criteria for creating an AuditEvent as a result of the bot invocation. Possible values are 'always', 'never', 'on-error', or 'on-output'. Default value is 'always'.

properties.name: auditEventDestination
properties.definition: The destination system in which the AuditEvent is to be sent. Possible values are 'log' or 'resource'. Default value is 'resource'.

properties.name: sourceCode
properties.definition: Bot logic in original source code form written by developers.

properties.name: executableCode
properties.definition: Bot logic in executable form as a result of compiling and bundling source code.

properties.name: code
properties.definition: DEPRECATED Bot logic script. Use Bot.sourceCode or Bot.executableCode instead.

searchParameters.name: category
searchParameters.description: The category of the bot for the classification for service
